Key Match Events: Kyle Higashioka's solo homer started a five-run rally in the second inning.
Manny Machado added a two-run double with the bases loaded.
Jackson Merrill hit a two-run triple.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres were looking to win a World Series title in memory of late owner Peter Seidler.
The game was a high-stakes matchup against the Dodgers in the NL Division Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt praised the team's resilience.
Braves manager Brian Snitker expressed pride in the team's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Petco Park with a sellout crowd of 47,705.
The Padres eliminated the 111-win Dodgers in a 2022 NLDS.
Others: Higashioka became the first Padres catcher to homer in consecutive playoff games.
Musgrove left the game with right elbow tightness.
